title: Attention Is All You Need
authors: Ashish Vaswani, Noam Shazeer, Niki Parmar, Jakob Uszkoreit, Llion Jones, Aidan N. Gomez, Lukasz Kaiser, Illia Polosukhin
keyAssumptions: RNNs and CNNs are necessary for sequence transduction; Sequential computation limits parallelization
citation: Vaswani, A., Shazeer, N., Parmar, N., Uszkoreit, J., Jones, L., Gomez, A. N., ... & Polosukhin, I. (2017). Attention is all you need. Advances in neural information processing systems, 30.
notes: Foundational paper introducing the Transformer architecture. Key innovation: self-attention mechanism allows modeling dependencies without recurrence or convolution.

title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding
authors: Jacob Devlin, Ming-Wei Chang, Kenton Lee, Kristina Toutanova
keyAssumptions: Unidirectional language models are sufficient for pre-training; Fine-tuning requires task-specific architectures
citation: Devlin, J., Chang, M. W., Lee, K., & Toutanova, K. (2019). BERT: Pre-training of deep bidirectional transformers for language understanding. In Proceedings of NAACL-HLT (pp. 4171-4186).
notes: Introduces bidirectional pre-training using masked language modeling. Shows that deep bidirectional representations significantly improve downstream task performance.

title: The AI Scientist: Towards Fully Automated Open-Ended Scientific Discovery
authors: Chris Lu, Cong Lu, Robert Tjarko Lange, Jakob Foerster, Jeff Clune, David Ha
keyAssumptions: Scientific research requires human oversight across all phases; AI can only assist with isolated tasks; Full automation compromises scientific rigor
citation: Lu, C., Lu, C., Lange, R. T., Foerster, J., Clune, J., & Ha, D. (2024). The AI Scientist: Towards Fully Automated Open-Ended Scientific Discovery. arXiv preprint arXiv:2408.06292.
notes: First comprehensive system for fully automatic scientific discovery. Automates idea generation, coding, experimentation, analysis, and manuscript writing at ~$15 per paper.

title: AI-Researcher: Autonomous Scientific Innovation
authors: Jiabin Tang, Lianghao Xia, Zhonghang Li, Chao Huang
keyAssumptions: Scientific discovery requires human creativity; LLMs lack reasoning depth for autonomous hypothesis generation; Complex experimental pipelines need human oversight
citation: Tang, J., Xia, L., Li, Z., & Huang, C. (2025). AI-Researcher: Autonomous Scientific Innovation. arXiv preprint arXiv:2505.18705.
notes: Eliminates template dependency, transcends human cognitive limitations in solution space exploration. Introduces Scientist-Bench evaluation framework.

title: AgentRxiv: Towards Collaborative Autonomous Research
keyAssumptions: Autonomous agents must work independently; Research quality degrades when AI systems build upon each other; Scientific collaboration requires human mediation
citation: Schmidgall, S., & Moor, M. (2025). AgentRxiv: Towards Collaborative Autonomous Research. arXiv preprint arXiv:2503.18102.
notes: Enables collaborative autonomous research through shared preprint servers. Demonstrates 13.7% improvement through agent collaboration vs isolation.

title: InternAgent: When Agent Becomes the Scientist -- Building Closed-Loop System from Hypothesis to Verification
keyAssumptions: Hypothesis generation and verification are separate processes; AI cannot maintain scientific rigor across complete research loops; Verification requires human judgment
citation: InternAgent Team. (2025). InternAgent: When Agent Becomes the Scientist -- Building Closed-Loop System from Hypothesis to Verification. arXiv preprint arXiv:2505.16938.
notes: Implements complete closed-loop research cycles integrating hypothesis formation with systematic experimental verification.

title: Robin: A multi-agent system for automating scientific discovery
authors: Ali Essam Ghareeb, Benjamin Chang, Ludovico Mitchener, et al.
keyAssumptions: Wet lab experimentation cannot be integrated with computational research; Multi-agent coordination introduces too much complexity; Biological research requires extensive human oversight
citation: Ghareeb, A. E., Chang, B., Mitchener, L., et al. (2025). Robin: A multi-agent system for automating scientific discovery. arXiv preprint arXiv:2505.13400.
notes: First AI system to discover and validate novel therapeutic (ripasudil for dAMD) in lab-in-the-loop framework. Extends autonomous research to experimental biology.

title: The AI Scientist-v2: Workshop-Level Automated Scientific Discovery via Agentic Tree Search
authors: Yutaro Yamada, Robert Tjarko Lange, Cong Lu, et al.
keyAssumptions: Autonomous research requires human-provided templates; AI-generated research cannot meet peer-review standards; Single-agent approaches are sufficient
citation: Yamada, Y., Lange, R. T., Lu, C., et al. (2025). The AI Scientist-v2: Workshop-Level Automated Scientific Discovery via Agentic Tree Search. arXiv preprint arXiv:2504.08066.
notes: First entirely AI-generated peer-review-accepted workshop paper. Eliminates template dependency through progressive agentic tree-search methodology.
